Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: The strength is that it's really practical, providing some good coding training in r. However, the weakness, from my perspective, is that it's too ambitious in the contents to cover. Most of the topics (e.g. generalized linear model or neural network) are really A LOT in themselves but only very superficial things were covered.
Lectures were disorganized but well intended
A good course for me to learn some basic ideas of computational statistics. But I hope this course could cover more topics in machine learning.

Strengths: useful contents
Weakness: homework instructions not given clearly
The course is good but the work is too much.
Great class on very enthralling material. Prof. Kane was a little disorganized, but he and Daiwei were always very helpful and nice.

Professor Kane is really good at coding and conveying the basic ideas in coding to us. I learnt a lot in terms of coding in R, which could be otherwise hard to understand by simply reading online blogs or by practice.
I would suggest Professor Kane to more prepared in the materials to cover, especially the maths, such that we would be able to learn more in a limited section.

A nice and patient instructor. But I hope he could be better prepared for each class, because it's a waste of time if we need to debug during the class. And for the textbook we used, there were many typos which caused a lot misunderstandings for me.
Great!! Knowledge on R package and GitHub is very useful!!
The instructor is good but is not reachable in some cases.
Very helpful and nice but a little disorganized

This is a relatively low-workload class where you can learn practical coding and data visualization stuffs but you may not gain in deep insight about the topics covered because this is NOT what this course is designed for. If you are interested in the theory of some of the models in this course, you should spend more time after class to learn by other materials or take courses in statistics department instead.

A good starting course for people who want to know the computation behind many statistical methods, like linear models, generalized linear models, LASSO, Ridge regression, and neuron networks. I would recommend it.
The course is challenging and requires a lot of work.
Yes, I would recommend this course
Great class on very enthralling material. Prof. Kane was a little disorganized, but he and Daiwei were always very helpful and nice. Definitely take.
